did.unittitle: John Charles Frémont letter to Henry Stephens Randall
did.abstract: Letter from Frémont to historian Henry Stephens Randall informing him that some books mailed by Randall had never been received.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: John Charles Frémont letter to Henry Stephens Randall, 1856 December 11, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, May 2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: John Charles Frémont or Fremont was an American explorer, politician, and soldier who, in 1856, became the first candidate of the Republican Party for the office of President of the United States.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letter from Frémont to historian Henry Stephens Randall informing him that some books mailed by Randall had never been received.
